{"uri": "8150079103", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:17:05", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:17:05Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:15:49Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8901960849761963, "url": "https://medicinehatnews.com/news/world-news/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-allies-de-niro-and-first-responders-to-trumps-ny-trial-to-keep-focus-on-jan-6/", "title": "Biden campaign sends allies De Niro and first responders to Trump's NY trial to keep focus on Jan. 6 - Medicine Hat News", "body": "FILE - Robert De Niro attends the 15th annual Tribeca Festival Artists Dinner hosted by CHANEL at Balthazar, June 13, 2022, in New York. President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial in an effort to refocus the race on the Jan. 6 2021 Capitol insurrection. Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago, was looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending actor Robert De Niro and some of the first responders at the Capitol that day. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP, file)WASHINGTON (AP) - President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection. It was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending actor Robert De Niro and some of the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. A top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings. \"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\"\u009d Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\u009d The Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected. \"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\"\u009d De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\u009d \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\"\u009d De Niro added. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\u009d Former Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory. \"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said. Added Dunn, who recently lost a Democratic primary race for the House in Maryland, \"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump. It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\" Trump's allies planned their own press conference Tuesday, with the Republican former president's adviser Jason Miller saying the Democratic president's event proved Trump's argument that his prosecution was politically motivated. \"Joe's crookeds aren't in PA, MI, WI, NV, AZ or GA - they're outside the Biden Trial against President Trump,\"\u009d he posted on X. \"It's always been about politics.\"\u009d", "source": {"uri": "medicinehatnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Medicine Hat News"}, {"uri": "8150427121", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "19:47:28", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T19:47:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T19:46:39Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8705882430076599, "url": "https://baynews9.com/fl/tampa/news/2024/05/28/de-niro-trump-biden-jan-6-new-york-trial", "title": "Robert De Niro slams Trump at presser outside N.Y. courthouse", "body": "The Biden campaign made a stop outside of the New York courtroom where former President Donald Trump's hush money trial was taking place Tuesday morning -- starring Robert De Niro.\n\nIt's a shift in strategy for President Joe Biden's reelection bid, which has largely ignored Trump's criminal trial up until now. But the event did not focus on the hush money case. Instead, it was a campaign speech filled with attacks on Donald Trump.\n\nJoining De Niro were two former Capitol Police officers who clashed with Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021: Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn. A Biden campaign official said the event was being held near the courthouse to take advantage of the contingent of media gathered there.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Michael Tyler, the Biden campaign's communication director, said to reporters at the event. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe press conference follows the Biden campaign unveiling an ad last week in which De Niro called Trump \"blatantly stupid,\" \"a punk,\" \"a con\" and \"an embarrassment to this country,\" adding, \"I'd like to punch him in the face.\"\n\nDe Niro continued to go after Trump on Tuesday as he claimed freedom and democracy are on the line in the election.\n\n\"Under Trump, this kind of government will perish from the earth,\" the \"Goodfellas\" star said. \"I don't mean to scare you. No, no, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And the elections, forget about it. That's all done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" he added. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nDe Niro said he hopes his ad campaign will reach \"outside the bubble to remind supporters of what a danger he is to our lives.\"\n\n\"This is not a threat; this is a reality,\" De Niro said. \"And that's why I've joined the Biden-Harris campaign, because the only way to preserve our freedoms and hold on to our humanity is to vote for Joe Biden for president. Really. We don't have a choice.\"\n\nAt one point, De Niro got into an exchange with a Trump supporter. De Niro had just called them \"true heroes,\" when the heckler accused them of lying under oath and called them \"traitors.\"\n\n\"I don't even know how to deal with you,\" De Niro told the man.\n\n\"They stood there and fought for us, for you. For you!\" the actor added.\n\nAfter the heckler responded, \"They weren't fighting for me,\" De Niro told him: \"No, no they fought for you, buddy. You're able to stand right here now.\"\n\nFanone said he was there to remind Americans \"of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all Americans on Jan. 6, 2021.\"\n\nHe said Trump supporters who attacked police officers were fueled by Trump's lies about fraud in the presidential election, adding the lies \"continue to this day\" and \"inspire my fellow Americans to turn against their fellow Americans, to turn against police officers.\"\n\nDunn said: \"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill.\"\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he said. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nDe Niro got into a heated exchange with Trump supporters after he walked away from the news conference.\n\nVideo shows the actor, surrounded by a sea of journalists, telling Trump supporters, \"You are gangsters!\"\n\nAfter one of them tells De Niro, \"You're washed up,\" the \"Taxi Driver\" star responds, \"F*** you!\"\n\nAnother Trump supporter then hit De Niro with a series of insults as the movie star walked away.\n\n\"You're a punk!\" the man wearing a red \"Make America Great\" cap said. \"You're a softy! You're a nobody! Your movies suck! You're trash! You're trash! You're done! You're done after this!\"\n\nTrump senior campaign adviser Jason Miller called De Niro a \"washed-up actor\" and decried the fact that Biden's reelection bid \"showed up and made a campaign event out of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump.\" Trump campaign press secretary Karoline Leavitt called it \"a full-blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top\" -- even though in recent weeks, allies of the former president, including elected Republican officials and former rivals for the GOP presidential nomination, have taken to holding press conferences of their own outside of the courthouse to rail against the case and show their support for Trump.\n\nTrump's eldest sons, Donald Trump Jr. and Eric Trump, and daughter-in-law Lara Trump, the co-chair of the Republican National Committee, held a press conference of their own on Tuesday to rail against the case.\n\n\"He needs attention because it's been a while since he cranked out a good movie,\" Donald Trump Jr. said of De Niro, adding of the Biden campaign: \"The fact that they are holding a rally across the street from this very witch hunt, right across the street, tells us exactly what we all knew all along, which is that it is a political persecution.\"", "source": {"uri": "baynews9.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Spectrum News Bay News 9"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalise on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the Goodfellas actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on January 6.\n\nA top Biden adviser said they were not there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\nRobert De Niro speaks to reporters across the street from former president Donald Trump\u00b4s criminal trial in New York (Seth Wenig/AP)\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing towards the courthouse.\n\n\"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, and probably the only one before the November election.\n\nThere are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Mr Biden: a federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference.\n\nHe has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticising Trump's presidency and plans if he is re-elected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nRobert De Niro argues with a Donald Trump supporter after speaking to reporters in support of President Joe Biden across the street from Trump\u00b4s criminal trial in New York (Seth Wenig/AP)\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington DC police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on January 6, with Mr Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress's certification of Mr Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on January 6 2021,\" Mr Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the January 6 2021 riot.\n\nHundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Mr Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\nFormer president Donald Trump speaks to the media outside his trial at Manhattan Criminal Court in New York (Steven Hirsch/New York Post via AP, Pool)\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added.\n\n\"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box {"uri": "2024-05-371105610", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "16:23:59", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T16:23:59Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T14:43:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8627451062202454, "url": "https://www.capitalgazette.com/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-allies-de-niro-and-first-responders-to-trumps-ny-trial-to-put-focus-on-jan-6/", "title": "Biden campaign sends allies De Niro and first responders to Trump's NY trial to put focus on Jan. 6", "body": "By COLLEEN LONG and ZEKE MILLER (Associated Press)\n\nWASHINGTON (AP) -- President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and a pair of former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the former president's role in the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the \"Goodfellas\" actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. Biden's campaign had been wary about feeding into Trump's argument that his criminal trials were the result of politically motivated prosecutions, but ultimately it decided to engage because its message about the stakes of the election was struggling to break through the intense focus on the trial.\n\nA top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial -- and De Niro and the officers didn't reference the sordid criminal case directly -- rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings. But Trump advisers argued in a dueling press conference that the Biden team's presence validated the Republican former president's claims that his prosecutions are being driven by politics.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe back-to-back press conferences were a side show to the main event playing out inside the courthouse, where closing arguments were under way in the only Trump trial likely to surface before the November election. There are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Biden, a Democrat: A federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference. He has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot. Hundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Harry Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's campaign staffers held their own news conference at the same spot outside the courthouse to respond to De Niro, the Jan. 6 officers and the Biden campaign.\n\nTrump's senior campaign adviser, Jason Miller, called De Niro -- who won Oscars for his roles in \"The Godfather: Part II\" and \"Raging Bull\" -- \"a washed-up actor\" and said the Biden news conference proved Trump's arguments that the trial, like the others the former president is facing, was motivated by politics.\n\n\"After months of saying politics had nothing to do with this trial, they showed up and made a campaign event out of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump,\" Miller said.\n\nKaroline Leavitt, the Trump campaign's press secretary, called the Biden campaign \"desperate and failing\" and \"pathetic\" and said its event outside the trial was \"a full-blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top.\"", "source": {"uri": "capitalgazette.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Capital Gazette"}, "authors": [{"uri": "associated_press@capitalgazette.com", "name": "Associated Press", {"uri": "8150126152", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:47:44", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:47:44Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:47:04Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8627451062202454, "url": "https://medicinehatnews.com/news/world-news/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-allies-de-niro-and-first-responders-to-trumps-ny-trial-to-put-focus-on-jan-6/", "title": "Biden campaign sends allies De Niro and first responders to Trump's NY trial to put focus on Jan. 6 - Medicine Hat News", "body": "FILE - Robert De Niro attends the 15th annual Tribeca Festival Artists Dinner hosted by CHANEL at Balthazar, June 13, 2022, in New York. President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial in an effort to refocus the race on the Jan. 6 2021 Capitol insurrection. Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago, was looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending actor Robert De Niro and some of the first responders at the Capitol that day. (Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP, file)WASHINGTON (AP) - President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and a pair of former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection. It was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the \"Goodfellas\"\u009d actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. A top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings. \"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\"\u009d Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\u009d The New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, likely the only one before the November election. There are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Biden: A federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference. He has pleaded not guilty in those cases. The Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected. \"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\"\u009d De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\u009d The actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\"\u009d the city. \"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\u009d Former Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory. \"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said. The two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot. Hundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours. \"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\"\u009d said Harry Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland. \"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\" Trump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics.\"\u009d \"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out a retread like {"uri": "8150136602", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:54:33", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:54:33Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:54:10Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.pbs.org/newshour/politics/watch-robert-de-niro-and-jan-6-first-responders-speak-outside-trumps-hush-money-trial", "title": "WATCH: Robert De Niro and Jan. 6 first responders speak outside Trump's hush money trial", "body": "Warning: This video contains verbal obscenities from off-screen protesters.\n\nWASHINGTON (AP) -- President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and a pair of former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the \"Goodfellas\" actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. A top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\nLive updates: Closing arguments in Trump's hush money trial\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, likely the only one before the November election. There are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Biden: A federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference. He has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot. Hundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\nWATCH: Tamara Keith and Amy Walter on the state of the presidential race heading into the summer\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics.\"\n\n\"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out a retread like Robert {"uri": "2024-05-371077701", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:56:51", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:56:51Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T14:43:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8392156958580017, "url": "https://www.mcall.com/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-allies-de-niro-and-first-responders-to-trumps-ny-trial-to-put-focus-on-jan-6/", "title": "Biden campaign sends allies De Niro and first responders to Trump's NY trial to put focus on Jan. 6", "body": "By COLLEEN LONG and ZEKE MILLER (Associated Press)\n\nWASHINGTON (AP) -- President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and a pair of former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the \"Goodfellas\" actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. A top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, likely the only one before the November election. There are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Biden: A federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference. He has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot. Hundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Harry Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics.\"\n\n\"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out a retread like Robert De Niro,\" he said.", "source": {"uri": "mcall.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Morning Call"}, "authors": [{"uri": "associated_press@mcall.com", "name": "Associated Press", This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said De Niro.\n\nTrump hush money trial live coverage: Judge calls defense closing argument 'outrageous'\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nRobert De Niro accused of berating pro-Palestinian protesters during filming for Netflix show\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. They take him seriously now.\"\n\nThis article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Robert De Niro calls Donald Trump a 'clown' outside court: See video", "source": {"uri": "aol.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8150141166", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:58:28", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:58:28Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:57:32Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8313725590705872, "url": "https://jerseyeveningpost.com/morenews/worldnews/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-de-niro-to-trump-trial-to-put-focus-on-2021-capitol-attack/", "title": "Biden campaign sends De Niro to Trump trial to put focus on 2021 Capitol attack", "body": "President Joe Biden's campaign showed up outside former president Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and two former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the January 6 2021 US Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Mr Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalise on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the Goodfellas actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on January 6.\n\nA top Biden adviser said they were not there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\nThe New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, and probably the only one before the November election.\n\nThere are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Mr Biden: a federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference.\n\nHe has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticising Trump's presidency and plans if he is re-elected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington DC police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on January 6, with Mr Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress's certification of Mr Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on January 6 2021,\" Mr Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the January 6 2021 riot.\n\nHundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Mr Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics\".\n\n\"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out a retread like Robert De Niro,\" he said.", "source": {"uri": "jerseyeveningpost.com", A top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" De Niro added. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said.\n\nAdded Dunn, who recently lost a Democratic primary race for the House in Maryland, \"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump. It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's allies planned their own press conference Tuesday, with the Republican former president's adviser Jason Miller saying the Democratic president's event proved Trump's argument that his prosecution was politically motivated.\n\n\"Joe's crookeds aren't in PA, MI, WI, NV, AZ or GA - they're outside the By enlisting Robert De Niro and first responders, Biden's team aimed to exploit media coverage. The move sparked a response from Trump's allies, who argued it demonstrated political motivation.\n\nPresident Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol insurrection.\n\nBiden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago, was looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending actor Robert De Niro and some of the first responders at the Capitol that day. A top adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" said Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\" The Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" De Niro told reporters. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country and eventually, he could destroy the world.\" Trump's allies planned their own press conference Tuesday, with the Republican former president's adviser Jason Miller saying the Democratic president's event proved Trump's argument that his prosecution was politically motivated.\n\n\"Joe's crookeds aren't in PA, MI, WI, NV, AZ or GA - they're outside the Biden Trial against President Trump,\" he posted on X. \"It's always been about politics.\"\n\n(This story has {"uri": "8150195024", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "16:36:35", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T16:36:35Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T16:35:21Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8274509906768799, "url": "https://www.dailyecho.co.uk/news/national/24351147.biden-campaign-sends-de-niro-trump-trial-put-focus-2021-capitol-attack/", "title": "Biden campaign sends De Niro to Trump trial to put focus on 2021 Capitol attack", "body": "It was a sharp about-face for Mr Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalise on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the Goodfellas actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on January 6.\n\nMr Biden's campaign had been wary about feeding into Trump's argument that his criminal trials were the result of politically motivated prosecutions, but ultimately it decided to engage because its message about the stakes of the election was struggling to break through the intense focus on the trial.\n\nA top Biden adviser said they were not there to talk about the trial - and De Niro and the officers did not reference the sordid criminal case directly - rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\nBut Trump advisers argued in a duelling press conference that the Biden team's presence validated the Republican former president's claims that his prosecutions are being driven by politics.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing towards the courthouse.\n\n\"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe back-to-back press conferences were a side show to the main event playing out inside the courthouse, where closing arguments were under way in the only Trump trial likely to surface before the November election.\n\nThere are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Mr Biden, a Democrat: a federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference.\n\nHe has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticising Trump's presidency and plans if he is re-elected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington DC police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on January 6, with Mr Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress's certification of Mr Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on January 6 2021,\" Mr Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the January 6 2021 riot.\n\nHundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Mr Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added.\n\n\"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's campaign staff held their own news conference at the same spot outside the courthouse to respond to De Niro, the January 6 officers and the Biden campaign.\n\nTrump's senior campaign adviser, Jason Miller, called De Niro - who won Oscars for his roles in The Godfather: Part II and Raging Bull - \"a washed-up actor\" and said the Biden news conference proved Trump's arguments that the trial, like the others the former president is facing, was motivated by politics.\n\n\"After months of saying politics had nothing to do with this trial, they showed up and made a campaign event out of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump,\" Mr Miller said.\n\nKaroline Leavitt, the Trump campaign's press secretary, called the Biden campaign \"desperate and failing\" and \"pathetic\" and said its event outside the trial was \"a full-blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top\".", "source": {"uri": "dailyecho.co.uk", "dataType": "news", "title": "Southern Daily Echo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": You are gangsters. You are gangsters!\" De Niro shouts at the Trump supporters, as expletives are hurled at him by by the swarming and raucous crowd.\n\nDe Niro was appearing on behalf of the Joe Biden-Kamala Harris presidential campaign, just outside the Manhattan court where Trump's closing hush money trial arguments are underway. The former president denies criminal charges of falsifying business documents ahead of the 2016 election.\n\nAs the Oscar-winning star walks to his vehicle, Trump supporters continue to hurl insults at De Niro, while security guards push back the angry crowd.\n\n\"You're not going to intimidate. That's what Trump does. They try to intimidate. And we're going to fight back!\" De Niro says in another video, posted to X by NewsNation's Kristen Eskow.\n\nNewsweek emailed a representative for De Niro for further comment about Tuesday's press conference.\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn joined De Niro and spoke of their personal experiences in the January 6 Capitol riot. Fanone described his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\nDe Niro consistently faced interruptions from Trump supporters on the scene in Manhattan. A honking horn in the background also drowned out portions of De Niro's remarks.\n\nOne Trump supporter called the January 6 Capitol police officers \"traitors\" who \"lied under oath. De Niro fired back: \"I don't even know how to deal with you, my friend. I don't even know how to deal with you!\"\n\nAt the end of his remarks outside the courthouse, another Trump supporter shouted that Dunn and Fanone were \"traitors.\"\n\nDe Niro then replied, \"They stood there. They didn't have to. They stood there and fought for us. They fought for you, buddy. You're able to stand right here. They are the true heroes. I'm honored to be with these two heroes today.\"\n\nDe Niro added that the former President wants to \"sow total chaos,\" and people in the crowd screamed \"f*** you\" as the actor continued speaking.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye, that we all take for granted,\" De Niro said. \"If he gets in... he will never leave.\"\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" De Niro added. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nDe Niro also called Trump a \"two-bit playboy.\"\n\n\"Donald Trump doesn't belong in my city. We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" the actor said. \"A two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids. He's a clown. But this person can't run the country. That does not work, and we all know that.\"\n\nTuesday's press conference marked a notable turn for the Biden campaign, which has largely dismissed the hush money trial since it began six weeks ago.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters before the press conference, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nJason Miller, a senior adviser to the Trump campaign, took aim at De Niro's appearance on Tuesday morning.\n\n\"Don't worry, my remarks will be shorter than The Irishman,\" Miller said, referencing De Niro's three-plus hour Netflix movie. \"The best that Biden can do is roll out a washed-up actor.\"\n\nDe Niro was nominated for the 2024 Best Forget about it. That's over. That's done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\nAs the conference continued, the Republican National Committee excoriated De Niro for wearing a mask and participating in a \"deranged witch hunt\" against Trump in a social media post. The conference was unusually chaotic as protesters yelled epithets and a car alarm disrupted De Niro as he spoke.\n\nAt one point De Niro had to contend with a bystander who defended the Jan. 6 rioters and called the police officers \"traitors.\"\n\n\"I don't even know how to deal with you, my friend,\" De Niro said to the man in a bit of back-and-forth at the press conference.\n\nDe Niro continued to be taunted by Trump supporters when he left the press conference.\n\nDe Niro recently narrated a 30-second \"Snapped\" ad for the Biden campaign that blasted Trump for being \"out of control\" when he lost the 2020 election.\n\n\"I hope this new ad campaign reaches outside the bubble to remind supporters of what a danger he is to our lives. This is not a threat. This is our reality,\" De Niro warned. \"And that's why I've joined the Biden-Harris campaign because the only way to preserve our freedoms and hold on to our humanity is to vote for Joe Biden for president.\"\n\nIn a twist of the law-and-order campaign that Republicans have long run in support of, De Niro also blamed rising crime rates on Trump.\n\n\"It's no surprise that the murder rate and other violent crimes peaked under Trump and are now falling under Biden,\" he said. \"And now he's promising to use our own military to attack U.S. citizens. That's the tyrant.\"\n\nFeatured Local Savings\n\nTrump's campaign surrogates quickly responded to the allegations from De Niro, slamming him as a \"retread\" in their own press conference on Tuesday.\n\n\"The Biden folks have finally done it. After months of saying politics had nothing to do with this trial, they showed up and made a campaign event of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump,\" said Trump campaign spokesman Jason Miller, who argued Biden made the public relations change because he's losing in the polls. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise and the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nTuesday marks the beginning of the closing arguments of the trial against Trump after more than four weeks and nearly two dozen witnesses testified before the jury. The Biden campaign has stayed away from commenting on the trial until Tuesday during the surprise press conference.\n\nOther Biden campaign surrogates pointed to the violence of the Capitol riot as an example of why Trump should not be reelected. They, too, were met with profanities and a car alarm blasting as they spoke.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of,\" Fanone said. \"And the violence that he unleashed on all Americans on Jan. 6, 2021.\"\n\nFanone recounted the harrowing story of being beaten by protesters who descended on the Capitol in 2021.\n\nCLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER\n\n\"I'm just one representative of the hundreds of police officers that were assaulted that day by Donald Trump supporters inspired by his lies,\" he said. \"The lies that continue to this day to inspire my fellow Americans to turn against their fellow Americans to turn against police officers.\"\n\nDunn recently lost a Democratic primary for Maryland's 3rd Congressional District this month but has continued to campaign with Democrats against Trump, who he blames for the Capitol riot.\n\n\"Donald Trump is the greatest threat to our democracy and the safety of communities across the country today,\" Dunn said. \"Political violence is never acceptable. But you have a presidential candidate, you have a presidential candidate that champions it, that encourages it, that supports it. We cannot have that.\"\n\nSign Up for Springs AM Update Your morning rundown of the latest news from Colorado Springs and around the country\n\nSign Up View all of our newsletters. Success! Donald Trump has created this. He should be telling them not to do this... he wants to sow total chaos, which he's succeeding in some areas and places to do,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No no, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss away these freedoms that we take for granted and elections, forget about it... he will never leave,\" he added.\n\nTyler also said that the campaign wanted to warn against Trump ahead of the first presidential debate, which is set for June.\n\n\"We want to remind the American people ahead... of the first debate on June 27 of the unique, persistent, growing threat Donald Trump poses to the American people and towards democracy,\" Tyler said.\n\nPolice officers who defended the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, Dunn and Fanone, stood behind De Niro as he criticized Trump over actions both before and after his career in politics.\n\n\"I love this city, I don't want to destroy it. He said that Trump rallied \"an angry mob\" on Jan. 6, saying that he \"ran and hid in the White House\" during it.\n\n\"He doesn't get blood on his hands... he directs the angry mob to do his dirty work for him,\" he said.\n\nFanone spoke after De Niro, describing in detail the brutality that happened to him during the Jan. 6 riots at the Capitol. Dunn then spoke, arguing that Trump \"encourages\" political violence.\n\nSenior adviser Jason Miller, after the Biden team press conference, called De Niro a \"washed up\" actor and cited a report {"uri": "8150153945", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "16:06:56", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T16:06:56Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T16:06:22Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8156862854957581, "url": "https://buffalonews.com/news/national/govt-and-politics/biden-campaign-sends-allies-de-niro-and-first-responders-to-trumps-ny-trial-to-put/article_70e563cb-7a16-5ee4-b120-ba950af36f75.html", "title": "Biden campaign sends allies De Niro and first responders to Trump's NY trial to put focus on Jan. 6", "body": "Robert De Niro speaks to reporters in support of President Joe Biden across the street from former President Donald Trump's criminal trial in New York, Tuesday, May 28, 2024.\n\nBy COLLEEN LONG and ZEKE MILLER - Associated Press\n\nWASHINGTON (AP) -- President Joe Biden's campaign on Tuesday showed up outside former President Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and a pair of former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the former president's role in the Jan. 6, 2021, U.S. Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalize on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the \"Goodfellas\" actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on Jan. 6. Biden's campaign had been wary about feeding into Trump's argument that his criminal trials were the result of politically motivated prosecutions, but ultimately it decided to engage because its message about the stakes of the election was struggling to break through the intense focus on the trial.\n\nPeople are also reading... Lancaster officials want speedway to cut down on noise Bills observations: Keon Coleman shows his size on bigger Bills WR corps Rasmus Dahlin captured bronze, but Dylan Cozens was Sabres' biggest winner at Worlds Buffalo State deficit plan to cut 37 underused programs, offer buyouts Bills Mailbag: Predicting breakout players for 2024 The story behind Josh Allen emulating lookalike Chris Pratt in Bills schedule video Removal of historic marker from Allentown church stirs controversy Buffalo Bills players, coaches spend day visiting 12 schools around the area School board turnover rampant, district budgets pass in elections in Erie and Niagara counties A 'warning sign': Census data shows Buffalo is again losing population Erie County real estate transactions Sabres roundtable: Charting a course for another eventful offseason Defensive tackle Austin Johnson acclimates to Buffalo Bills 'It's terrible': Family Dollar closures will erase six stores from the East Side New Bills WR Marquez Valdes-Scantling hitches his wagon to superstar QBs\n\nA top Biden adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial -- and De Niro and the officers didn't reference the sordid criminal case directly -- rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings. But Trump advisers argued in a dueling press conference that the Biden team's presence validated the Republican former president's claims that his prosecutions are being driven by politics.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe back-to-back press conferences were a side show to the main event playing out inside the courthouse, where closing arguments were under way in the only Trump trial likely to surface before the November election. There are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Biden, a Democrat: A federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference. He has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said. \"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on Jan. 6, with Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress' certification of Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the Jan. 6, 2021, riot. Hundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Harry Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added. \"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's campaign staffers held their own news conference at the same spot outside the courthouse to respond to De Niro, the Jan. 6 officers and the Biden campaign.\n\nTrump's senior campaign adviser, Jason Miller, called De Niro -- who won Oscars for his roles in \"The Godfather: Part II\" and \"Raging Bull\" -- \"a washed-up actor\" and said the Biden news conference proved Trump's arguments that the trial, like the others the former president is facing, was motivated by politics.\n\n\"After months of saying politics had nothing to do with this trial, they showed up and made a campaign event out of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump,\" Miller said.\n\nKaroline Leavitt, the Trump campaign's press secretary, called the Biden campaign \"desperate and failing\" and \"pathetic\" and said its event outside the trial was \"a full-blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top.\"\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. {"uri": "8150160908", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "16:11:32", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T16:11:32Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T16:11:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8078431487083435, "url": "https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/news/campaigns/presidential/3018995/robert-de-niro-biden-event-trump-new-york-trial/", "title": "Robert De Niro slams 'clown' Trump during first Biden counter event at New York trial - Washington Examiner", "body": "The Biden campaign denounced former President Donald Trump as a threat to democracy during their first press conference held outside the courthouse where Trump's hush money trial case is wrapping up.\n\nAcademy Award-winning actor Robert De Niro joined the campaign in Manhattan along with Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, former police officers who defended the Capitol during the Jan. 6, 2021, riot, where he blasted Trump as a \"clown\" and claimed Trump would be a danger to the nation if he is reelected.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted,\" De Niro said as onlookers shouted profanities at him while he spoke. \"And elections. Forget about it. That's over. That's done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\nAs the conference continued, the Republican National Committee excoriated De Niro for wearing a mask and participating in a \"deranged witch hunt\" against Trump in a social media post. The conference was unusually chaotic as protesters yelled epithets and a car alarm disrupted De Niro as he spoke.\n\nAt one point De Niro had to contend with a bystander who defended the Jan. 6 rioters and called the police officers \"traitors.\"\n\n\"I don't even know how to deal with you, my friend,\" De Niro said to the man in a bit of back-and-forth at the press conference.\n\nDe Niro recently narrated a 30-second \"Snapped\" ad for the Biden campaign that blasted Trump for being \"out of control\" when he lost the 2020 election.\n\n\"I hope this new ad campaign reaches outside the bubble to remind supporters of what a danger he is to our lives. This is not a threat. This is our reality,\" De Niro warned. \"And that's why I've joined the Biden-Harris campaign because the only way to preserve our freedoms and hold on to our humanity is to vote for Joe Biden for president.\"\n\nIn a twist of the law-and-order campaign that Republicans have long run in support of, De Niro also blamed rising crime rates on Trump.\n\n\"It's no surprise that the murder rate and other violent crimes peaked under Trump and are now falling under Biden,\" he said. \"And now he's promising to use our own military to attack U.S. citizens. That's the tyrant.\"\n\nTrump's campaign surrogates quickly responded to the allegations from De Niro, slamming him as a \"retread\" in their own press conference on Tuesday.\n\n\"The Biden folks have finally done it. After months of saying politics had nothing to do with this trial, they showed up and made a campaign event of a lower Manhattan trial day for President Trump,\" said Trump campaign spokesman Jason Miller, who argued Biden made the public relations change because he's losing in the polls. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise and the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nTuesday marks the beginning of the closing arguments of the trial against Trump after more than four weeks and nearly two dozen witnesses testified before the jury. The Biden campaign has stayed away from commenting on the trial until Tuesday during the surprise press conference.\n\nOther Biden campaign surrogates pointed to the violence of the Capitol riot as an example of why Trump should not be reelected. They, too, were met with profanities and a car alarm blasting as they spoke.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of,\" Fanone said. \"And the violence that he unleashed on all Americans on Jan. 6, 2021.\"\n\nFanone recounted the harrowing story of being beaten by protesters who descended on the Capitol in 2021.\n\nCLICK HERE TO READ MORE FROM THE WASHINGTON EXAMINER\n\n\"I'm just one representative of the hundreds of police officers that were assaulted that day by Donald Trump supporters inspired by his lies,\" he said. \"The lies that continue to this day to inspire my fellow Americans to turn against their fellow Americans to turn against police officers.\"\n\nDunn recently lost a Democratic primary for Maryland's 3rd Congressional District this month but has continued to campaign with Democrats against Trump, who he blames for the Capitol riot.\n\n\"Donald Trump is the greatest threat to our democracy and the safety of communities across the country today,\" Dunn said. \"Political violence is never acceptable. But you have a presidential candidate, you have a presidential candidate that champions it, that encourages it, that supports it. {"uri": "8150133925", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "15:52:57", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T15:52:57Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:52:23Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.8078431487083435, "url": "https://www.shropshirestar.com/news/world-news/2024/05/28/biden-campaign-sends-de-niro-to-trump-trial-to-put-focus-on-2021-capitol-attack/", "title": "Biden campaign sends De Niro to Trump trial to put focus on 2021 Capitol attack", "body": "Trump adviser Jason Miller suggested that the Biden team's presence validated Donald Trump's contention that his criminal issues were 'all politics'.\n\nPresident Joe Biden's campaign showed up outside former president Donald Trump's New York City criminal hush money trial with actor Robert De Niro and two former police officers in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the January 6 2021 US Capitol insurrection.\n\nIt was a sharp about-face for Mr Biden's team, which had largely ignored the trial since it began six weeks ago and is now looking to capitalise on its drama-filled closing moments, sending the Goodfellas actor and the first responders who were at the Capitol on January 6.\n\nA top Biden adviser said they were not there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler told reporters, gesturing towards the courthouse.\n\n\"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe New York trial is the first of four criminal trials for Trump, and probably the only one before the November election.\n\nThere are two others directly related to the Republican's efforts to undo his 2020 loss to Mr Biden: a federal case in Washington is related to his efforts to overturn the results of the 2020 presidential election, and a state case in Georgia accuses him of election interference.\n\nHe has pleaded not guilty in those cases.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticising Trump's presidency and plans if he is re-elected.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington DC police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on January 6, with Mr Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress's certification of Mr Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on January 6 2021,\" Mr Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the January 6 2021 riot.\n\nHundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Mr Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added.\n\n\"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics\".\n\n\"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said De Niro.\n\nTrump hush money trial live coverage: Judge calls defense closing argument 'outrageous'\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country and eventually he could destroy the world,' De Niro said.\n\nA group of Trump supporters could be heard in the background chanting, 'f*** Joe Biden.'\n\nActor Robert De Niro showed up outside of former President Donald Trump's hush money trial Tuesday as a guest of President Joe Biden's campaign\n\nDe Niro called Trump a slew of names and then had some heated altercations with some of the former president's supporters\n\n'We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,' De Niro said of Trump. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro told reporters.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\nThe actor cast himself as the true New Yorker and mocked Trump's history of sometimes-unsuccessful business ventures and self-promotion, saying Trump was looking to \"destroy\" the city.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another crappy real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" De Niro said.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nFormer Washington DC police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn spoke of their personal experiences on January 6, with Mr Fanone describing his injuries suffered at the hands of the mob of Trump supporters seeking to halt Congress's certification of Mr Biden's 2020 presidential victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on January 6 2021,\" Mr Fanone said.\n\nThe two former officers were also witnesses during a congressional investigation of the January 6 2021 riot.\n\nHundreds of law enforcement officers were beaten and bloodied in the attack by Trump supporters, who descended after a rally and smashed into the Capitol while Trump remained silent for hours.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" said Mr Dunn, a former Capitol police officer who ran unsuccessfully for office in Maryland.\n\n\"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump,\" he added.\n\n\"It's going to take us Americans at the ballot box to defeat him once and for all.\"\n\nTrump's aides held their own press conference after the Democrats concluded, with adviser Jason Miller suggesting that the Biden team's presence validated Trump's contention that his criminal issues were \"all politics\".\n\n\"If you don't think this is politics, why did the Democrats wheel out And that's why it's so weird that Donald Trump is just across the street because he doesn't belong in my city. I don't know where he belongs, but he certainly doesn't belong here. We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot,\" he said.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro continued. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"And elections. Forget about it. That's over. That's done,\" the actor continued. \"If he gets in. I can tell you right now. He will never leave. He will never leave. You know that. He will never leave,\" he ranted.\n\n\"The only way to preserve our freedoms and hold on to our humanity is to vote for Joe Biden for president,\" De Niro declared.\n\nThe point of the presser was purportedly \"to draw a stark contrast\" between Trump's campaign as it is hobbled by multiple political prosecutions, and Joe Biden's allegedly more dignified and presidential campaign.\n\nJoe Biden's communication director Michael Tyler told reporters that they chose the Manhattan venue to capitalize on the media presence outside the courtroom.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Tyler said. \"We're here today because you all are here,\" he added.\n\nFanone and Dunn took the opportunity to discuss the Jan 6 riot and warned that a second Trump term would lead to authoritarianism.\n\n\"At the end of the day, this election is about Donald Trump and his vision for the office of the president of the United States, not as a public servant who answers to the elected, to the people who elected him, but as an authoritarian, who answers to and serves only himself,\" Fanone said.\n\nAfter the presser, De Niro clashed with Trump supporters, angrily calling them \"gangsters.\"\n\nAfter the Biden Camp finished its press conference, Jason Miller, a Trump campaign advisor came out and spoke with reporters.\n\n\"Why is Joe Biden making this [the New York Trump trial] a campaign event after months of weaponizing the legal system against President Trump?\" asked Miller. \"Because Joe Biden's numbers are in the tank.\"\n\n\"Last week, President Trump spoke in the Bronx where over 25,000 people showed up to rally around him,\" Miller continued. \"And the best the Biden campaign could do was to put out a web video with Robert Ne Niro.\"\n\nHe added: \"There is nothing behind the Biden campaign. There numbers are in the toilet. 'I love this city I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country and eventually he could destroy the world,' De Niro said.\n\nA group of Trump supporters could be heard in the background chanting, '[Expletive] Joe Biden.' 'That's the tyrant he's telling us he'll be,' the actor warned.
