{"uri": "8150274397", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:38:58", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:38:58Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:34:30Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.772549033164978, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/robert-niro-jan-6-first-172259265.html", "title": "Robert De Niro, Jan. 6 First Responders Speak Outside Courthouse as Trump Trial Wraps: 'A Clown'", "body": "\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted,\" De Niro said outside the Manhattan criminal courthouse during Trump's closing arguments\n\nAs closing arguments in Donald Trump's historic criminal trial began, the Biden reelection campaign sent actor Robert De Niro and Jan. 6 first responders to speak outside the New York City courthouse where the case has unfolded.\n\nPresident Joe Biden's campaign showed up outside the Manhattan criminal courthouse on Tuesday, May 28, amid Trump's \"hush money\" trial, which began on April 15. Trump, 77, is facing 34 felony counts of falsified business records related to how he allegedly documented reimbursements for a hush money payment made to former adult film actress Stormy Daniels.\n\nBiden, 81, has stayed quiet about Trump's trial so far, and according to the Associated Press, a Biden adviser told reporters that the campaign wasn't there to talk about the trial, but rather to take advantage of the major media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden 2024 communications director Michael Tyler said. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe move was an effort to refocus the presidential race on the riot at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, according to AP.\n\nRelated: Joe Biden and Donald Trump Agree to 2 Presidential Debates in June and September\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro, 80, told reporters outside the courthouse. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" added De Niro, who was born in Manhattan. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer.\n\n\"He doesn't belong in my city, I don't know where he belongs, but he certainly doesn't belong here,\" he continued, per Fox News. \"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit Playboy lying his way into the tabloids, pretending to be a spokesman, a spokesperson for himself. He was calling it as himself for himself, to fool the press into inflating his net worth.\"\n\n\"A clown, but this city is pretty accommodating. We make room for clowns. We have them all over the city, people who do crazy things in the street, we tolerate it, it's part of the city, it's part of the culture, but not a person like Trump who'll eventually run the country, that does not work and we all know that,\" he said.\n\nRelated: Donald Trump Appears to Fall Asleep in Court During First Day of Criminal Trial: Report\n\nDe Niro's appearance outside the courthouse comes after the Biden campaign released a new advertisement narrated by De Niro that criticized Trump seeking another White House term and called him \"out of control.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn also spoke outside the courthouse on Tuesday, according to AP.\n\nFanon described his injuries from the riot, which took place two months after Trump lost the 2020 election to Biden and saw Trump supporters storm the Capitol in a bid to overturn the election result as lawmakers gathered inside to certify Biden's victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said, per AP.", "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.newsmax.com/newsfront/robert-de-niro-donald-trump-joe-biden/2024/05/28/id/1166475/", "title": "Robert De Niro: Trump Supporters Are 'Low Lifes'", "body": "Actor Robert De Niro called supporters of Donald Trump \"low lifes\" at a Tuesday press conference organized by President Joe Biden's reelection campaign outside the Manhattan courthouse where closing arguments are taking place in the former president's paperwork trial.\n\nAccording to video posted on X by The Post Millennial, De Niro called Trump supporters \"low lifes\" as a car honked repeatedly in the background and said he didn't \"even know how to deal with\" a heckler who said the two former Capitol police officers standing behind him \"lied under oath.\"\n\nMichael Fanone and Harry Dunn were Capitol police officers during the breach of the U.S. Capitol building on Jan. 6, 2021, Axios reported.\n\nDe Niro then accused Trump, a fellow native New Yorker, of wanting to destroy New York City and the United States, as well as the world.\n\n\"I owe this city a lot,\" De Niro said, and \"that's why it's so weird that Donald Trump is just across the street.\"\n\n\"He doesn't belong in my city,\" De Niro said. \"I don't know where he belongs, but he certainly doesn't belong here.\"\n\nAccording to De Niro, New Yorkers used to \"tolerate\" Trump when he was \"just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot\" or \"a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids.\"\n\nThe actor added that Trump was \"a clown,\" but said the city is \"pretty accommodating\" for clowns, as \"it's part of the culture.\"\n\nResponding to Trump supporters yelling outside the courthouse, De Niro said, \"These people over here, it's kinda crazy.\"\n\n\"It's really crazy, and this thing, Donald Trump, has created this,\" he said. \"He should be telling them not to do this, but he's just, he wants to sow total chaos which he's succeeding in some areas and places to do.\"\n\nDe Niro said no one took Trump seriously until people around the country, \"who didn't know him as we did,\" started supporting him and \"bought into his bull****.\" The former president \"bought their votes with outrageous lies and empty promises,\" he said.\n\nThe actor then predicted that the United States' form of government \"will perish from the earth\" if Trump wins a second term in November.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you, no wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" he said. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And elections, forget about it. That's over, that's done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\nBiden Communications Director Michael Tyler sought to highlight the differences between the Joe Biden and his predecessor to the gathered media scrum.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Tyler said, according to Axios. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\n\"We're here primarily because of the threat that Donald Trump poses to the United States of America and to our democracy,\" he said.\n\nTyler also claimed that the \"looming threat of MAGA extremism has only grown stronger since Jan. 6\" and said \"we're gonna campaign on the president's record, on his vision, and we're gonna run against the extremism embodied by Donald Trump as he sits in that building or anywhere else across the country.\"\n\nNicole Wells \u2709\n\nNicole Wells, a Newsmax general assignment reporter covers news, politics, and culture. {"uri": "2024-05-371161025", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:21:13", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:21:13Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T13:11:00Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7647058963775635, "url": "https://www.usnews.com/news/top-news/articles/2024-05-28/robert-de-niro-calls-trump-a-clown-outside-trial-in-biden-campaign-message", "title": "Robert De Niro Calls Trump a 'Clown' Outside Trial in Biden Campaign Message", "body": "Actor Robert De Niro speaks during a news conference outside the court where former U.S. President Donald Trump during Trump's criminal trial on charges that he falsified business records to conceal money paid to silence porn star Stormy Daniels in 2016, in Manhattan state court New York City, U.S., May 28, 2024. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid\n\nWASHINGTON (Reuters) - Actor Robert De Niro called Donald Trump a \"clown\" who is bent on destroying American democracy on Tuesday outside the New York City courtroom where the Republican presidential candidate's hush money trial is being held.\n\nDe Niro, a longtime Democrat who recently voiced an ad for Democratic President Joe Biden, attended a Biden campaign event outside the Manhattan courtroom with two former law enforcement officers, Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, who were at the U.S. Capitol when it was attacked by Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\nThe remarks are part of the Biden campaign's attempt to use wall-to-wall media coverage of the Trump trial to push their own message: Trump is a danger to democracy.\n\nTrump's campaign dismissed the event as a stunt.\n\nReferring to Trump's successful 2016 run for president, Academy Award winner De Niro said Trump's candidacy was initially laughed off as a joke.\n\n\"We've forgotten the lessons of history that showed us other clowns who weren't taken seriously until they became vicious dictators,\" he said. \"With Trump we have a second chance and no one is laughing now. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. They take him seriously now.\"\n\n(Reporting by Doina Chiacu and Trevor Hunnicutt; editing by Deepa Babington)", "source": {"uri": "usnews.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "U.S. News & World A top adviser said they weren't there to talk about the trial, rather to exploit the large media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" said Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler, gesturing toward the courthouse. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" De Niro told reporters. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country and eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nTrump's allies planned their own press conference Tuesday, with the Republican former president's adviser Jason Miller saying the Democratic president's event proved Trump's argument that his prosecution was politically motivated.\n\n\"Joe's crookeds aren't in PA, MI, WI, NV, AZ or GA - they're outside the Biden Trial against President Trump,\" he posted on X. \"It's always been about politics.\"\n\nCopyright 2024 The Associated Press. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" about Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed-up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown... {"uri": "8150250959", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:16:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:16:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:15:42Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://www.devdiscourse.com/article/politics/2953314-robert-de-niro-slams-trump-as-clown-at-biden-campaign-event", "title": "Robert De Niro Slams Trump as 'Clown' At Biden Campaign Event | Politics", "body": "At a Biden campaign event, actor Robert De Niro criticized Donald Trump, labeling him a 'clown' dangerous to American democracy. De Niro's remarks aimed to leverage media coverage of Trump's trial to convey Biden's message. Trump supporters dismissed the event as a desperate stunt by the Biden camp.\n\nBy Doina Chiacu and Trevor Hunnicutt WASHINGTON, May 28 (Reuters) -\n\nActor Robert De Niro called Donald Trump a \"clown\" who is bent on destroying American democracy on Tuesday outside the New York City courtroom where the Republican presidential candidate's hush money trial is being held. De Niro, a longtime Democrat who recently voiced an ad for Democratic President Joe Biden, attended a Biden campaign event outside the Manhattan courtroom with two former law enforcement officers, Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, who were at the U.S. Capitol when it was attacked by Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\nThe remarks are part of the Biden campaign's attempt to use wall-to-wall media coverage of the Trump trial to push their own message: Trump is a danger to democracy. Trump's campaign dismissed the event as a stunt.\n\nReferring to Trump's successful 2016 run for president, Academy Award winner De Niro said Trump's candidacy was initially laughed off as a joke. \"We've forgotten the lessons of history that showed us other clowns who weren't taken seriously until they became vicious dictators,\" he said. \"With Trump we have a second chance and no one is laughing now. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections. \"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background. Trump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him. \"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters. In his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. They take him seriously now.\"\n\n(This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.)", "source": {"uri": "devdiscourse.com", "dataType": "news", {"uri": "8150345462", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "18:34:17", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T18:34:17Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T18:33:51Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7568627595901489, "url": "https://www.ntd.com/robert-de-niro-jan-6-police-officers-rally-for-biden-outside-trump-trial-in-manhattan_995838.html", "title": "Robert De Niro, Jan. 6 Police Officers Rally for Biden Outside Trump Trial in Manhattan", "body": "As Judge Juan Merchan hears closing arguments in former President Donald Trump's New York criminal trial, actor Robert De Niro and two former Jan. 6 police officers spoke on behalf of the Biden campaign outside the courtroom on May 28.\n\nThe press conference -- hosted by President Joe Biden's communication director, Michael Tyler -- sought to refocus the election narrative on Jan. 6 and the speakers' fears of another Trump presidency.\n\nPresident Trump maintains that the Biden administration was responsible for his indictment in New York, even though it's a state-level case. The press conference marked a key moment where President Biden's campaign took a turn and waded into a trial they had avoided for the past six weeks.\n\nMr. Tyler told reporters the campaign visited the Manhattan courthouse on May 28 because \"you all are here,\" referring to members of the media.\n\n\"We want to remind the American people ahead of the next debate ... of the unique, persistent, and growing threat that Donald Trump poses to the American people and to our democracy. So since you all are here, we are here communicating that message,\" he said.\n\nMr. Tyler was asked if there was a political motivation for the Biden campaign's visit to the courthouse, given President Trump's accusations of politically motivated prosecutions in his multiple criminal indictments.\n\n\"Again. You all are already here,\" Mr. Tyler replied. \"It's easy to talk about the choice in this election when the entire news media is camped out here day in and day out.\"\n\nHowever, questions about whether President Biden would comment on the case or whether the state-level trial is a \"political weaponization of the Justice Department\" went unanswered. Trump advisers hosted a separate press conference where they suggested that the presence of the Biden campaign outside the courthouse validated the political narrative of the prosecution.\n\nMr. Tyler said they were there not for the trial but to speak to the media about \"the entirety of what voters are going to be taking to the ballot box\" ahead of the first presidential debate in June.\n\nMr. De Niro and the two Jan. 6 police officers, Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn, did not discuss the trial in their speeches.\n\nThe actor, known for movies like \"The Godfather Part 2,\" \"Taxi Driver,\" and \"Goodfellas,\" was featured in a Biden campaign ad the previous week where he criticized President Trump and his reelection platform.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, no, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted,\" Mr. De Niro said at the press conference.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\nMr. De Niro said that New Yorkers like himself \"used to tolerate\" President Trump, who is also a New Yorker, but alleges the former president wants to \"destroy\" the City of Dreams.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nAs he spoke, the actor was heckled by several supporters of the former president and, at one point, stopped to argue with a man who accused Mr. Fanone and Mr. Dunn of lying about their experiences on Jan. 6.\n\n\"My friend, I don't even know how to deal with you,\" Mr. De Niro said to the heckler. \"They stood there and fought for us, for you.\"\n\nMr. Fanone, a former DC police officer, recounted the moment when Jan. 6 protesters tried to take his weapon as he was \"beaten\" by people in the crowd. He alleged that President Trump isn't running to be a \"public servant\" but rather as an \"authoritarian who answers to and serves only himself.\"\n\nMr. Dunn, a former Capitol police officer, said Americans \"need to wake up\" and that \"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump.\"\n\nJason Miller, President Trump's senior campaign adviser, called Mr. De Niro a \"washed-up actor\" and argued the press conference proved the former president's allegations about the trial's political motivations.\n\nKaroline Leavitt, the Trump campaign's press secretary, echoed those comments and said the event was a \"full-blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top.\"", "source": {"uri": "ntd.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "NTD"}, "authors": [], I don't want to destroy it,\" said the actor to reporters. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country and eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nDe Niro painted a picture of what downtown New York City looked like after the 9/11 attacks in 2001, saying \"we vowed we'd never allow terrorists... I owe this city a lot.\"\n\nTrump supporters outside the courthouse could be heard shouting in the background as De Niro spoke.\n\nDe Niro continued to criticize Trump calling him a \"clown.\"\n\nTrump's campaign quickly fired back.\n\n\"What you just heard from is a desperate and failing and pathetic campaign who knows that they are losing. Joe Biden sending his campaign outside of this criminal courthouse it is a full blown concession that this trial is a witch hunt that comes from the top comes from Joe Biden and he is using a far left District Attorney in this city Alvin Bragg. This case would have been laughed out of any other courtroom in America, legal scholars on both sides of the aisle even liberal legal scholars agree there is no crime there is no case, but Joe Biden knew he could use Alvin Bragg, who is sitting in that courthouse today, wasting away the tax dollars of the hard working people of this city to go after, Joe Biden's political opposition,\" said Trump campaign staffer Karoline Leavitt.\n\nTrump's trial on Tuesday turns on the testimony of a prosecution witness. {"uri": "8150283015", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:42:12", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:42:12Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:41:05Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7529411911964417, "url": "https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/robert-de-niro-calls-trump-a-clown-outside-trial-in-biden-campaign-message/articleshow/110505828.cms", "title": "Robert De Niro calls Trump a 'clown' outside trial in Biden campaign message - Times of India", "body": "WASHINGTON: Actor Robert De Niro called Donald Trump a \"clown\" who is bent on destroying American democracy on Tuesday outside the New York City courtroom where the Republican presidential candidate's hush money trial is being held.\n\nDe Niro, a longtime democrat who recently voiced an ad for Democratic president Joe Biden, attended a Biden campaign event outside the Manhattan courtroom with two former law enforcement officers, Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, who were at the US Capitol when it was attacked by Trump supporters on Jan.6, 2021.\n\nThe remarks are part of the Biden campaign's attempt to use wall-to-wall media coverage of the Trump trial to push their own message: Trump is a danger to democracy.\n\nTrump's campaign dismissed the event as a stunt.\n\nReferring to Trump's successful 2016 run for president, Academy Award winner De Niro said Trump's candidacy was initially laughed off as a joke.\n\n\"We've forgotten the lessons of history that showed us other clowns who weren't taken seriously until they became vicious dictators,\" he said. \"With Trump we have a second chance and no one is laughing now. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. {"uri": "8150339483", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "18:29:29", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T18:29:29Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T18:28:54Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7490196228027344, "url": "https://www.theepochtimes.com/us/robert-de-niro-jan-6-police-officers-rally-for-biden-outside-trump-trial-at-manhattan-court-5658356", "title": "Robert De Niro, Jan. 6 Police Officers Rally for Biden Outside Trump Trial in Manhattan", "body": "The actor, flanked by Biden Communication Director Michael Tyler and two Jan. 6 police officers, alleges President Trump 'will never leave' office if reelected.\n\nAs Judge Juan Merchan hears closing arguments in former President Donald Trump's New York criminal trial, actor Robert De Niro and two former Jan. 6 police officers spoke on behalf of the Biden campaign outside the courtroom on May 28.\n\nThe press conference -- hosted by President Joe Biden's communication director, Michael Tyler -- sought to refocus the election narrative on Jan. 6 and the speakers' fears of another Trump presidency.\n\nPresident Trump maintains that the Biden administration was responsible for his indictment in New York, even though it's a state-level case. The press conference marked a key moment where President Biden's campaign took a turn and waded into a trial they had avoided for the past six weeks.\n\nMr. Tyler told reporters the campaign visited the Manhattan courthouse on May 28 because \"you all are here,\" referring to members of the media.\n\n\"We want to remind the American people ahead of the next debate ... of the unique, persistent, and growing threat that Donald Trump poses to the American people and to our democracy. So since you all are here, we are here communicating that message,\" he said.\n\nMr. Tyler was asked if there was a political motivation for the Biden campaign's visit to the courthouse, given President Trump's accusations of politically motivated prosecutions in his multiple criminal indictments.\n\n\"Again. You all are already here,\" Mr. Tyler replied. \"It's easy to talk about the choice in this election when the entire news media is camped out here day in and day out.\"\n\nHowever, questions about whether President Biden would comment on the case or whether the state-level trial is a \"political weaponization of the Justice Department\" went unanswered. Trump advisers hosted a separate press conference where they suggested that the presence of the Biden campaign outside the courthouse validated the political narrative of the prosecution.\n\nMr. Tyler said they were there not for the trial but to speak to the media about \"the entirety of what voters are going to be taking to the ballot box\" ahead of the first presidential debate in June.\n\nMr. De Niro and the two Jan. 6 police officers, Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn, did not discuss the trial in their speeches.\n\nThe actor, known for movies like \"The Godfather Part 2,\" \"Taxi Driver,\" and \"Goodfellas,\" was featured in a Biden campaign ad the previous week where he criticized President Trump and his reelection platform.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, no, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted,\" Mr. De Niro said at the press conference.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave.\"\n\nMr. De Niro said that New Yorkers like himself \"used to tolerate\" President Trump, who is also a New Yorker, but alleges the former president wants to \"destroy\" the City of Dreams.\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nAs he spoke, the actor was heckled by several supporters of the former president and, at one point, stopped to argue with a man who accused Mr. Fanone and Mr. Dunn of lying about their experiences on Jan. 6.\n\n\"My friend, I don't even know how to deal with you,\" Mr. De Niro said to the heckler. \"They stood there and fought for us, for you.\"\n\nMr. Fanone, a former DC police officer, recounted the moment when Jan. 6 protesters tried to take his weapon as he was \"beaten\" by people in the crowd. He alleged that President Trump isn't running to be a \"public servant\" but rather as an \"authoritarian who answers to and serves only himself.\"\n\nMr. Dunn, a former Capitol police officer, said Americans \"need to wake up\" and that \"We can't count on these institutions to stop Donald Trump.\"\n\nJason Miller, President Trump's senior campaign adviser, called Mr. De Niro a \"washed-up actor\" and argued the press conference proved the former president's allegations about the trial's political motivations.\n\nKaroline Leavitt, the Trump campaign's press secretary, echoed those A two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids, pretending to be a spokesman -- a spokesperson for himself,\" De Niro said.\n\nThe \"Taxi Driver\" and \"The Godfather Part II\" star described Trump as a threat to the United States, and said Trump fomented violence and destruction during the deadly riot at the U.S. Capitol Jan. 6, 2021, by a mob of Trump's supporters.\n\nDe Niro said he decided to lend his talents to a Biden-Harris campaign ad, \"because it shows the violence of Trump.\"\n\n\"But it's a coward's violence,\" said De Niro. \"You think Trump ever threw a punch himself, or took one? This guy, who ran and hid in the White House bunker when there were protesters outside? No way.\"\n\nDe Niro was joined at the event by former U.S. Capitol Police officer Harry Dunn, one of the thousands of law enforcement officers who fought to protect the Capitol from the pro-Trump mob on Jan. 6.\n\nImmediately following the Biden campaign event, Trump campaign spokesman Jason Miller accused Biden of employing a \"washed-up actor\" to campaign for him in a Hail Mary attempt to reverse Trump's narrow lead in 2024 election polls.\n\nMiller spoke at the same microphone where De Niro had been speaking moments before.\n\nA short distance away, a fight broke out between rival groups of pro-Trump demonstrators, prompting police to enter the designated protest space to respond.\n\nThe De Niro event marks the first time the Biden campaign has appeared outside Trump's trial, which began more than five weeks ago.\n\nAs the criminal trial winds down, the president's reelection campaign is planning to crank up its attacks on Trump, NBC News reported Friday.\n\nThe shift comes ahead of the scheduled June 27 presidential debate between Trump and Biden, the first of two planned debates. While the presidential race is still very close nationally, Trump's lead in several battleground state polls is increasingly worrying Biden's Democratic allies.\n\nTrump stands accused of falsifying business records related to his reimbursement of a $130,000 hush money payment his former lawyer Michael Cohen made to porn star Stormy Daniels shortly before the 2016 presidential election.\n\nManhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg alleges those records were falsified with the intent to conceal an illegal effort to violate election laws.\n\nDefense attorney Todd Blanche began Tuesday's closing arguments by declaring, \"President Trump is innocent.\"\n\n\"He did not commit any crimes, and the District Attorney has not met their burden of proof,\" Blanche said.\n\nBlanche said he expects his closing arguments will last up to two-and-a-half hours. {"uri": "8150214761", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "16:50:54", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T16:50:54Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T16:50:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7411764860153198, "url": "https://nypost.com/2024/05/28/us-news/robert-de-niro-headlines-bizarre-biden-campaign-presser-outside-trump-trial-youre-a-f-ing-idiot/", "title": "Robert De Niro headlines bizarre Biden campaign presser outside Trump...", "body": "Oscar-winning actor Robert De Niro became the face of the Biden campaign Tuesday, fronting a tumultuous press conference outside the Manhattan courthouse where former President Donald Trump's defense team made their closing arguments in the hush money trial.\n\nAfter weeks of avoiding commenting on the case against Trump outside of jabs on social media, the Biden campaign went big by announcing the press availability \"with special guests\" on the day of closing arguments, with the jury expected to receive the case on Wednesday.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden campaign communication director Michael Tyler disingenuously told reporters, indicating the courthouse \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nDe Niro, 80, has already narrated ads for the Biden campaign, and told reporters Tuesday that Trump \"wants to sow total chaos,\" and \"destroy not only the city\" before expanding his argument to say \"eventually he could destroy the whole world.\"\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" he said at one point. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\n\n\"And elections. Forget about it. That's over. That's done. If he gets in. I can tell you right now. He will never leave. He will never leave. You know that. He will never leave.\"\n\nIn between reading from his prepared remarks, which included calling the 77-year-old Trump a \"clown,\" a \"grubby real estate hustler\" and a \"tyrant\", the \"Raging Bull\" actor exchanged curses with pro-Trump protesters who chanted \"F-k Joe Biden\" and \"De Niro is a gangster b -- -\" in an attempt to drown out the presser.\n\n\"You're a f-ing idiot,\" the \"Goodfellas\" star yelled at one protester who accused De Niro of being a \"paid actor for the DNC\" and suggested the actor had unsavory ties to convicted pedophile Jeffrey Epstein.\n\nDe Niro was accompanied by law enforcement officers who battled Trump-supporting rioters at the Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" former DC cop Michael Fanone said.\n\n\"Americans need to wake up. This is not a drill,\" added former Capitol Police officer Harry Dunn, who unsuccessfully ran for Congress as a Democrat in Maryland earlier this year.\n\nTrump's press team came to the microphones immediately after Biden's team left, arguing that the president's campaign showing up at the courthouse shows that the trial amounts to \"election interference of the highest order.\"\n\n\"Crooked Joe Biden and his campaign are in complete freakout mode, and that's why they've gone back on the word and now they've gone in bed with a highly conflicted, conflicted judge, and now they're making a political mockery of this entire thing,\" campaign spokesperson Steven Cheung said.\n\nTrump 2024 national press secretary Karoline Leavitt added that \"actors like Robert De Niro\" have \"no idea the real problems that people in this city and across this country are facing.\n\n\"President Trump is backed by the hard-working men and women of this country, and I cannot help but laugh when Joe Biden's spokesperson actually came out here and accused President Trump of being a threat to democracy. Joe Biden is the real threat to democracy. He is weaponizing our justice system.\"\n\nPolls have consistently shown Trump maintaining a lead over Biden if the election would be held today, despite the ongoing Manhattan criminal case and three {"uri": "8150375145", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "18:59:49", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T18:59:49Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T18:59:09Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7372549176216125, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/coward-violence-robert-niro-trolls-184350677.html", "title": "'A coward's violence': Robert De Niro trolls Trump outside hush-money trial", "body": "It was a scenario that Donald Trump, in his pre-presidential celebrity days, might have relished; as he sat inside a Manhattan courtroom, Robert De Niro was waiting outside.\n\nBut this was politics and De Niro, the pugnacious star of myriad Hollywood gangster films, was there not to pay homage to the former president as a fellow VIP, but to diss him in terms that might have been in place in Goodfellas or Mean Streets.\n\nThe 80-year-old Oscar winner was present outside the New York courthouse where Trump's hush-money trial was reaching its closing stages on Tuesday as an operative of Joe Biden's re-election bid, deployed as a proxy while the president's campaign made its first clear foray into his opponent's complex legal woes.\n\nIntroduced by the Biden campaign communications director, Michael Tyler, De Niro - a vitriolic critic of Trump, who has provided the voiceover for a new 30-second advertisement warning of the perils of his return - adapted to the role with professional aplomb.\n\nRelated: Biden campaign releases De Niro-voiced video ad warning Trump has 'snapped'\n\n\"This is my neighbourhood, downtown New York City. I grew up here and feel at home in these streets,\" he said, before remarking on the strangeness of Trump being in a courtroom across the street, \"because he doesn't belong in my city\".\n\nThe former president and presumptive 2024 Republican presidential nominee had been tolerated in the Big Apple, said the actor, when he was \"just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot\".\n\nBut now the stakes had been raised and Trump, De Niro explained, had a vision of dictatorial power that had prompted him to step into the political arena, citing the mob violence from Trump's supporters that accompanied the storming of the US Capitol on 6 January 2021.\n\n\"That's why I needed to be involved ... in the new Biden-Harris ad, because it shows the violence of Trump,\" he said.\n\nDe Niro invoked the lessons of Monday's Memorial Day holiday, held to celebrate the US's fallen military heroes, and quoted Abraham Lincoln in saying they had died so that \"government of the people, by the people, for the people shall not perish from the earth\".\n\nStepping back into Hollywood gangland rhetoric, De Niro warned: \"Under Trump, this kind of government will perish from the earth. I don't mean to scare you. No, no, wait - maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And elections? Forget about it.\"\n\nBut arguably the most belittling reference concerned Trump's taste for political violence, which De Niro dismissed as \"a coward's violence\".\n\n\"You think Trump ever threw a punch himself or took one?\" he asked. \"No way. He doesn't get blood on his hands. He directs the mob to do his dirty work for him by making a suggestion, an inference.\"\n\nThe punch reference recalled Raging Bull, the 1980 biopic in which De Niro played Jake LaMotta, the turbulent boxer who was once world middleweight champion.\n\nHis depiction of LaMotta's sometimes menacing persona sprung to mind as the actor bristled at being heckled by a Trump supporter as he introduced two police officers, Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn, who had been present at the Capitol on 6 January 2021 as it was assailed by a mob trying to prevent Congress certifying Biden's 2020 election victory.\n\n\"They lied under oath,\" said the out-of-camera-shot heckler, who was heard to add: \"They're traitors.\"\n\nDe Niro glared then countered: \"Excuse me, they lied under oath. What are you saying? They're traitors. I don't even know how to deal with you, my friend.\n\n\"They stood there and fought for us, for you ... they fought for you, buddy, you're able to stand right here now. They are the true heroes.\"\n\nFanone, who served as a Washington DC police officer recounted how he was violently attacked and beaten by members of the mob, one of whom tried to take his firearm. All had been \"inspired by lies\" told by Trump, he said.\n\nComing to the microphone after De Niro had left the scene, Trump's campaign adviser, Jason Miller, ridiculed both Biden and the Hollywood star.\n\n\"The best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor - and don't worry, my remarks will be shorter than The Irishman,\" he said, invoking one of De Niro's later films, directed by Martin Scorsese. \"I won't make you suffer for three hours.\"", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, "authors": [], "concepts": [{"uri": Each was there to speak to the media about the \"threat\" Trump poses to the United States.\n\nWhile the Biden campaign spokesman said they were not there because of what was happening inside the courtroom but instead to speak to the assembled media, he went on to say, \"The contrast here pretty much writes itself. As we speak, Donald Trump, somewhere fighting for himself, maybe taking a power nap. And we've seen him for weeks and for months, we've seen the ramblings of an unhinged, power-hungry, self-centered man, both here, at Mar-a-Lago, on Truth Social, wherever he may be.\"\n\n-- (@)\n\nWhen it was De Niro's turn to speak, he invoked the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001, and said, like the terrorists who attacked New York City, Trump will destroy the Big Apple, the United States, and possibly the world.\n\n\"The Twin Towers fell just over here, just over there. This part of the city was like a ghost town, but we vowed we would not allow terrorists to change our way of life. And we started the Tribeca Festival to bring people back. I love this city. I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city, but the country, and eventually he could destroy the world,\" De Niro said.\n\n'If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye.'\n\n\"But we vowed we would not allow terrorists ... I owe this city a lot. That's why it is so weird that Donald Trump is just across the street. He doesn't belong in my city. I don't know where he belongs. But he certainly doesn't belong here. We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler ... big shot pretending to be a spokesman, a spokesperson for himself,\" he continued.\n\n-- (@)\n\nWhen De Niro started to shower praise on Dunn and Fanone, someone could be heard off camera telling De Niro they had lied under oath about what they did during the riot at the Capitol on January 6, 2021.\n\nDe Niro became exasperated during the exchange and tried to convince the man Dunn and Fanone had fought for the country.\n\n\"They stood there and fought, for us! For you!\" the actor shouted.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And elections? Forget about it. That's over, that's done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave. He will never leave. You know that. {"uri": "2024-05-371235536", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "18:53:44", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T18:53:44Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T18:43:50Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7333333492279053, "url": "https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/article/2024/may/28/robert-de-niro-biden-trump-hush-money-trial", "title": "'A coward's violence': Robert De Niro trolls Trump outside hush-money trial", "body": "Biden campaign holds press conference with Oscar winner and two Capitol officers in first clear foray into ex-president's legal troubles\n\nIt was a scenario that Donald Trump, in his pre-presidential celebrity days, might have relished; as he sat inside a Manhattan courtroom, Robert De Niro was waiting outside.\n\nBut this was politics and De Niro, the pugnacious star of myriad Hollywood gangster films, was there not to pay homage to the former president as a fellow VIP, but to diss him in terms that might have been in place in Goodfellas or Mean Streets.\n\nThe 80-year-old Oscar winner was present outside the New York courthouse where Trump's hush-money trial was reaching its closing stages on Tuesday as an operative of Joe Biden's re-election bid, deployed as a proxy while the president's campaign made its first clear foray into his opponent's complex legal woes.\n\nIntroduced by the Biden campaign communications director, Michael Tyler, De Niro - a vitriolic critic of Trump, who has provided the voiceover for a new 30-second advertisement warning of the perils of his return - adapted to the role with professional aplomb.\n\n\"This is my neighbourhood, downtown New York City. I grew up here and feel at home in these streets,\" he said, before remarking on the strangeness of Trump being in a courtroom across the street, \"because he doesn't belong in my city\".\n\nThe former president and presumptive 2024 Republican presidential nominee had been tolerated in the Big Apple, said the actor, when he was \"just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot\".\n\nBut now the stakes had been raised and Trump, De Niro explained, had a vision of dictatorial power that had prompted him to step into the political arena, citing the mob violence from Trump's supporters that accompanied the storming of the US Capitol on 6 January 2021.\n\n\"That's why I needed to be involved ... in the new Biden-Harris ad, because it shows the violence of Trump,\" he said.\n\nDe Niro invoked the lessons of Monday's Memorial Day holiday, held to celebrate the US's fallen military heroes, and quoted Abraham Lincoln in saying they had died so that \"government of the people, by the people, for the people shall not perish from the earth\".\n\nStepping back into Hollywood gangland rhetoric, De Niro warned: \"Under Trump, this kind of government will perish from the earth. I don't mean to scare you. No, no, wait - maybe I do mean to scare you. If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And elections? Forget about it.\"\n\nBut arguably the most belittling reference concerned Trump's taste for political violence, which De Niro dismissed as \"a coward's violence\".\n\n\"You think Trump ever threw a punch himself or took one?\" he asked. \"No way. He doesn't get blood on his hands. He directs the mob to do his dirty work for him by making a suggestion, an inference.\"\n\nThe punch reference recalled Raging Bull, the 1980 biopic in which De Niro played Jake LaMotta, the turbulent boxer who was once world middleweight champion.\n\nHis depiction of LaMotta's sometimes menacing persona sprung to mind as the actor bristled at being heckled by a Trump supporter as he introduced two police officers, Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn, who had been present at the Capitol on 6 January 2021 as it was assailed by a mob trying to prevent Congress certifying Biden's 2020 election victory.\n\n\"They lied under oath,\" said the out-of-camera-shot heckler, who was heard to add: \"They're traitors.\"\n\nDe Niro glared then countered: \"Excuse me, they lied under oath. What are you saying? They're traitors. I don't even know how to deal with you, my friend.\n\n\"They stood there and fought for us, for you ... they fought for you, buddy, you're able to stand right here now. They are the true heroes.\"\n\nFanone, who served as a Washington DC police officer recounted how he was violently attacked and beaten by members of the mob, one of whom tried to take his firearm. All had been \"inspired by lies\" told by Trump, he said.\n\nComing to the microphone after De Niro had left the scene, Trump's campaign adviser, Jason Miller, ridiculed both Biden and the Hollywood star.\n\n\"The best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor - and don't worry, my remarks will be shorter than The Irishman,\" he said, invoking one of De Niro's later films, directed by Martin Scorsese. \"I won't make you suffer for three hours.\"", "source": {"uri": "theguardian.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "The Guardian"}, "authors": [{"uri": {"uri": "8150269604", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:32:23", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:32:23Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:30:53Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://people.com/robert-de-niro-jan-6-responders-speak-outside-trump-courthouse-8654558", "title": "Robert De Niro, Jan. 6 First Responders Speak Outside Courthouse as Trump Trial Wraps: 'A Clown'", "body": "Kirsty Hatcher is an Associate Editor on the People.com Morning Team. She has been working at PEOPLE since 2023. Her work previously appeared on ok.co.uk, in OK! Magazine and Reach PLC magazines.\n\nAs closing arguments in Donald Trump's historic criminal trial began, the Biden reelection campaign sent actor Robert De Niro and Jan. 6 first responders to speak outside the New York City courthouse where the case has unfolded.\n\nPresident Joe Biden's campaign showed up outside the Manhattan criminal courthouse on Tuesday, May 28, amid Trump's \"hush money\" trial, which began on April 15. Trump, 77, is facing 34 felony counts of falsified business records related to how he allegedly documented reimbursements for a hush money payment made to former adult film actress Stormy Daniels.\n\nBiden, 81, has stayed quiet about Trump's trial so far, and according to the Associated Press, a Biden adviser told reporters that the campaign wasn't there to talk about the trial, but rather to take advantage of the major media focus on the legal proceedings.\n\n\"We're not here today because of what's going on over there,\" Biden 2024 communications director Michael Tyler said. \"We're here today because you all are here.\"\n\nThe move was an effort to refocus the presidential race on the riot at the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6, 2021, according to AP.\n\n\"I don't mean to scare you. No, wait, maybe I do mean to scare you,\" De Niro, 80, told reporters outside the courthouse. \"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted.\"\n\n\"I love this city. I don't want to destroy it,\" added De Niro, who was born in Manhattan. \"Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city but the country, and, eventually, he could destroy the world.\"\n\nNever miss a story -- sign up for PEOPLE's free daily newsletter to stay up-to-date on the best of what PEOPLE has to offer.\n\n\"He doesn't belong in my city, I don't know where he belongs, but he certainly doesn't belong here,\" he continued, per Fox News. \"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit Playboy lying his way into the tabloids, pretending to be a spokesman, a spokesperson for himself. He was calling it as himself for himself, to fool the press into inflating his net worth.\"\n\n\"A clown, but this city is pretty accommodating. We make room for clowns. We have them all over the city, people who do crazy things in the street, we tolerate it, it's part of the city, it's part of the culture, but not a person like Trump who'll eventually run the country, that does not work and we all know that,\" he said.\n\nDe Niro's appearance outside the courthouse comes after the Biden campaign released a new advertisement narrated by De Niro that criticized Trump seeking another White House term and called him \"out of control.\"\n\nFormer Washington, D.C., police officer Michael Fanone and former Capitol police officer Harry Dunn also spoke outside the courthouse on Tuesday, according to AP.\n\nFanon described his injuries from the riot, which took place two months after Trump lost the 2020 election to Biden and saw Trump supporters storm the Capitol in a bid to overturn the election result as lawmakers gathered inside to certify Biden's victory.\n\n\"I came here today to remind Americans of what Donald Trump is capable of and the violence that he unleashed on all of Americans on Jan. 6, 2021,\" Fanone said, per AP.", "source": {"uri": "people.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "PEOPLE.com"}, "authors": [], "concepts": {"uri": "8150254446", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:18:46", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:18:46Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:18:14Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.theblaze.com/news/robert-de-niro-warns-trump-could-destroy-the-world-in-unhinged-biden-campaign-presser", "title": "Robert De Niro warns Trump could destroy the world in unhinged Biden campaign presser | Blaze Media", "body": "The Biden campaign made the questionable decision to host a press conference outside the New York City courthouse where former President Donald Trump was on Tuesday morning, but campaign members were not alone.\n\nWith the Biden campaign was actor Robert De Niro and police officers Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn. Each was there to speak to the media about the \"threat\" Trump poses to the United States.\n\nWhile the Biden campaign spokesman said they were not there because of what was happening inside the courtroom but instead to speak to the assembled media, he went on to say, \"The contrast here pretty much writes itself. As we speak, Donald Trump, somewhere fighting for himself, maybe taking a power nap. And we've seen him for weeks and for months, we've seen the ramblings of an unhinged, power-hungry, self-centered man, both here, at Mar-a-Lago, on Truth Social, wherever he may be.\"\n\nWhen it was De Niro's turn to speak, he invoked the terrorist attacks on September 11, 2001, and said, like the terrorists who attacked New York City, Trump will destroy the Big Apple, the United States, and possibly the world.\n\n\"The Twin Towers fell just over here, just over there. This part of the city was like a ghost town, but we vowed we would not allow terrorists to change our way of life. And we started the Tribeca Festival to bring people back. I love this city. I love this city. I don't want to destroy it. Donald Trump wants to destroy not only the city, but the country, and eventually he could destroy the world,\" De Niro said.\n\n'If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye.'\n\n\"But we vowed we would not allow terrorists ... I owe this city a lot. That's why it is so weird that Donald Trump is just across the street. He doesn't belong in my city. I don't know where he belongs. But he certainly doesn't belong here. We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler ... big shot pretending to be a spokesman, a spokesperson for himself,\" he continued.\n\nWhen De Niro started to shower praise on Dunn and Fanone, someone could be heard off camera telling De Niro they had lied under oath about what they did during the riot at the Capitol on January 6, 2021.\n\nDe Niro became exasperated during the exchange and tried to convince the man Dunn and Fanone had fought for the country.\n\n\"They stood there and fought, for us! For you!\" the actor shouted.\n\n\"They didn't fight for me,\" the man shot back.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted. And elections? Forget about it. That's over, that's done. If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave. He will never leave. You know that. He will never leave,\" De Niro went on to say.\n\nOutside observers noted the poor optics of Biden's campaign hosting a press conference while closing arguments in Trump's trial were taking place, {"uri": "8150249849", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:17:00", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:17:00Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:14:45Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://ca.news.yahoo.com/robert-niro-calls-trump-clown-171147374.html", "title": "Robert De Niro calls Trump a 'clown' outside trial in Biden campaign message", "body": "WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Actor Robert De Niro called Donald Trump a \"clown\" who is bent on destroying American democracy on Tuesday outside the New York City courtroom where the Republican presidential candidate's hush money trial is being held.\n\nDe Niro, a longtime Democrat who recently voiced an ad for Democratic President Joe Biden, attended a Biden campaign event outside the Manhattan courtroom with two former law enforcement officers, Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, who were at the U.S. Capitol when it was attacked by Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\nThe remarks are part of the Biden campaign's attempt to use wall-to-wall media coverage of the Trump trial to push their own message: Trump is a danger to democracy.\n\nTrump's campaign dismissed the event as a stunt.\n\nReferring to Trump's successful 2016 run for president, Academy Award winner De Niro said Trump's candidacy was initially laughed off as a joke.\n\n\"We've forgotten the lessons of history that showed us other clowns who weren't taken seriously until they became vicious dictators,\" he said. \"With Trump we have a second chance and no one is laughing now. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. They take him seriously now.\"\n\n(Reporting by Doina Chiacu and Trevor Hunnicutt; editing by Deepa Babington)", "source": {"uri": "ca.news.yahoo.com", "dataType": "news", "title": "Yahoo"}, {"uri": "2024-05-371177430", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:40:42", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:40:42Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T15:50:29Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.729411780834198, "url": "https://www.kimt.com/news/biden-campaign-tries-new-tactic-deploying-robert-de-niro-outside-courthouse-as-trump-trial-closing/article_f25fe619-306f-5b6b-aae9-14f65b42029f.html", "title": "Biden campaign tries new tactic: Deploying Robert De Niro outside courthouse as Trump trial closing arguments begin", "body": "(CNN) -- After months of either ignoring or poking fun at former President Donald Trump's criminal trial, the Biden campaign on Tuesday decided for the first time to stage a news conference about Trump's record outside the courthouse where closing arguments were taking place.\n\nThe feisty event, which featured a surprise appearance from actor-turned-campaign-surrogate Robert De Niro, was not specifically intended to discuss aspects of the trial, the president's team insisted. But it was undoubtedly meant to draw attention to the criminal defendant inside the nearby building.\n\n\"If Trump returns to the White House, you can kiss these freedoms goodbye that we all take for granted,\" De Niro said, with chanting protesters and a car alarm blaring in the background. \"And elections -- forget about it, that's all. That's done, if he gets in, I can tell you right now -- he will never leave. He will never leave.\"\n\nPreviously, Biden's team had been wary of doing or saying anything that might appear to politicize the former president's trial. In their view, Trump's trial would speak for itself, reintroducing the former president and the chaos that surrounds him to voters who may have tuned him out.\n\nSome of Biden's allies had questioned that notion, however, suggesting Trump had already done plenty to politicize his legal issues and that Biden -- if he wanted to capture voters' attention -- would be wise to weigh in as well.\n\nTuesday's event amounted to a nod to the second approach.\n\n\"The entire news media is camped out here, day in and day out,\" campaign communications director Michael Tyler said, explaining the choice to address reporters outside the lower Manhattan courthouse.\n\nAside from De Niro, who recently narrated an ad slamming Trump, two police offers who were present at the US Capitol on January 6, 2021, and attacked by pro-Trump rioters were featured: Michael Fanone and Harry Dunn.\n\n\"At the end of the day, this election is about Donald Trump and his vision for the office of the president of the United States -- not as a public servant who answers to the elected -- to the people who elected him, but as an authoritarian, who answers to, and serves only, himself,\" Fanone said.\n\nTop Trump advisers Jason Miller, Steven Cheung and Karoline Leavitt spoke to reporters immediately after the news conference. Miller bashed the two-time Oscar winner.\n\n\"The best they can do is roll out a washed up actor,\" Miller said.\n\nHe echoed Trump's attacks on Judge Juan Merchan as \"corrupt\" and \"conflicted,\" and continued to argue the case was \"complete garbage.\"\n\nThe president's team sees an opening once the trial concludes to become more aggressive in their framing of Trump as a threat to democracy, all leading up to the CNN debate on June 27. On everything from the ads the campaign runs to the messaging and rhetoric that comes from the president himself to growing the campaign's infrastructure, a person familiar with the campaign's thinking said, the Biden team recognizes that once the Trump trial -- and the aggressive media coverage of it -- is over, there will be more room and opportunities to make their case to the American people ahead of November.\n\nBiden campaign officials are still grappling with the reality, this person said, that a substantial part of the population still doesn't see that the choice on Election Day will be between Biden and Trump.\n\nAnd while the campaign will need to calibrate its messaging and strategy based on how exactly Trump's trial ends, this person insisted that at the end of the day, the thrust of their case against the former president won't change -- whether Trump emerges a convicted felon or not.\n\nDe Niro presented the main theme of that messaging on Tuesday. He blasted the former president as \"a tyrant\" and \"a coward,\" telling reporters that as New Yorkers, they tolerated the former real estate mogul as \"just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids.\"\n\nAnd he said that the stakes of November's election are what prompted him to join the campaign for a new ad released last week.\n\n\"That's why I needed to be involved and wanted to be involved in the new Biden-Harris ad, because it shows the violence of Trump and reminds us that he'd use violence against anyone who stands in the way of his megalomania and greed,\" De Niro said. \"You think Trump ever threw a punch himself or took one? This guy ran and hid in the White House bunker when there were protesters outside -- no way. He doesn't get blood on his hands. No, he doesn't. He directs the mob to do his dirty work for him.\"\n\nAs CNN reported on Friday, the Biden campaign effectively launched the start of that next phase by releasing a scorching new ad called \"Snapped,\" narrated by Niro.\n\n\"We knew Trump was out of control when he was president,\" De Niro says over a shot of Trump behind the Resolute Desk. \"Then he lost the 2020 election and snapped.\"\n\nThe ad describes Trump as \"desperately\" trying to cling to power while showing images of the January 6, 2021, insurrection. The phrases \"dictator\" and \"terminate the Constitution\" flash on screen, followed by a clip of Trump saying, \"If I don't get elected, it's going to be a bloodbath.\"\n\nFanone, a former Washington, DC, Metropolitan Police Officer who was attacked during the January 6 insurrection, said that he was \"just one representative of the hundreds of police officers that were assaulted that day by Donald Trump's supporters inspired by his lies, the lies that continue to this day to inspire my fellow Americans to turn against their fellow Americans, to turn against police officers.\"\n\nDunn, a former US Capitol Police officer, called Trump \"the greatest threat to our democracy and the safety of communities across the country today.\"\n\n\"He has encouraged and continues to encourage political violence. We've been called traitors - just today. We were all called traitors on January 6, for doing our job,\" Dunn said. \"Political violence is never acceptable, but you have a presidential candidate that champions it, that encourages it, that supports it. We cannot have that.\"\n\nEarlier Tuesday, Biden's reelection campaign said it was enlisting police officers working at the US Capitol on January 6 to stump for Biden across battleground states in the coming weeks.\n\nSgt. Aquilino Gonell and officer Danny Hodges also plan to join Dunn in telling voters that Trump poses a threat to democracy and to their fundamental rights as Americans. Dunn and Gonell sustained injuries during the attack on the Capitol and have since retired from the Capitol Police. Hodges continues to serve with DC's Metropolitan Police Department.\n\nCNN's Kate Sullivan contributed to this report.\n\nThe-CNN-Wire\n\n\u2122 & \u00a9 2024 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. And if you reelect him, he's never going to leave office. He's going to make himself a tyrant for life.\" Are those the kind of credible statements that are going to cause people who don't like Biden and don't like Trump, but are trying to figure out who to vote for, are they going to cause people to say, 'well, geez, you now told me you wanted to destroy our country.' Of course he did. The people who believe that are already in the Biden camp. That's not who they should be trying to reach out to. He came close in a moment of talking about January 6th and talking about the two officers, but that might have had an impact. But this was so over-the-top as to simply be useless. {"uri": "8150278141", "lang": "eng", "isDuplicate": false, "date": "2024-05-28", "time": "17:38:48", "dateTime": "2024-05-28T17:38:48Z", "dateTimePub": "2024-05-28T17:37:33Z", "dataType": "news", "sim": 0.7215686440467834, "url": "https://gazette.com/news/us-world/robert-de-niro-calls-trump-a-clown-outside-trial-in-biden-campaign-message/article_14de65de-270b-5d27-b08b-75f266f5ae7c.html", "title": "Robert De Niro calls Trump a 'clown' outside trial in Biden campaign message", "body": "Actor Robert De Niro speaks exits following a news conference outside the court where former U.S. President Donald Trump during Trump's criminal trial on charges that he falsified business records to conceal money paid to silence porn star Stormy Daniels in 2016, in Manhattan state court New York City, U.S., May 28, 2024. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid\n\nBy Doina Chiacu and Trevor Hunnicutt\n\nWASHINGTON (Reuters) - Actor Robert De Niro called Donald Trump a \"clown\" who is bent on destroying American democracy on Tuesday outside the New York City courtroom where the Republican presidential candidate's hush money trial is being held.\n\nDe Niro, a longtime Democrat who recently voiced an ad for Democratic President Joe Biden, attended a Biden campaign event outside the Manhattan courtroom with two former law enforcement officers, Harry Dunn and Michael Fanone, who were at the U.S. Capitol when it was attacked by Trump supporters on Jan. 6, 2021.\n\nThe remarks are part of the Biden campaign's attempt to use wall-to-wall media coverage of the Trump trial to push their own message: Trump is a danger to democracy.\n\nTrump's campaign dismissed the event as a stunt.\n\nReferring to Trump's successful 2016 run for president, Academy Award winner De Niro said Trump's candidacy was initially laughed off as a joke.\n\n\"We've forgotten the lessons of history that showed us other clowns who weren't taken seriously until they became vicious dictators,\" he said. \"With Trump we have a second chance and no one is laughing now. This is the time to stop him by voting him out once and for all.\"\n\nIf Trump returns to the White House, he said, Americans could see the civil liberties they take for granted evaporate as well as the end of elections.\n\n\"If he gets in, I can tell you right now, he will never leave,\" said DeNiro.\n\nFanone and Dunn delivered emotional remarks, saying violence at the Capitol was fueled by Trump's lies that the 2020 election was stolen. The speakers were heckled by a Trump supporter as pro-Trump demonstrators chanted in the background.\n\nTrump campaign officials said the De Niro event showed desperation in the Biden camp.\n\nSpokesman Steven Cheung, taking the podium shortly afterwards, said the Biden camp was in \"complete freakout mode\" over Trump's resilience despite the multiple criminal cases against him.\n\n\"Joe Biden is losing nationally,\" said Jason Miller, another Trump spokesperson. \"President Trump's numbers continue to rise. And the best that Biden can do is roll out a washed up actor.\"\n\nA Reuters/Ipsos poll last week found the two men effectively tied among registered voters.\n\nIn his most biting comments, De Niro spoke of Trump through the lens of the largely Democratic city whose voters know Trump well and roundly rejected him at the polls.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit playboy lying his way into the tabloids,\" he said. \"A clown...No one took him seriously. They take him seriously now.\"\n\n(Reporting by Doina Chiacu and Trevor Hunnicutt; editing by Deepa Babington)\n\nSign Up for Springs AM Update Your morning rundown of the latest news from Colorado Springs and around the country\n\nSign Up View all of our newsletters. De Niro called Trump a \"clown\" and explained why he is supporting President Joe Biden and Vice President Kamala Harris.\n\nRobert De Niro appeared in New York City Tuesday at a gathering outside the courtroom where closing arguments were taking place in former President Donald Trump's hush money trial.\n\nDe Niro called Trump a clown and a buffoon and urged everyone to \"vote him out once and for all\" in November in order to maintain freedom and democracy, he claimed.\n\n\"If he gets in (the White House), I can tell you right now he will never leave,\" De Niro said. \"Is that the country we want to live in? Do we want him running this country and saying, 'I'm not leaving; I'm dictator for life?'\"\n\nDeNiro also spoke of knowing Trump in New York society over the decades before he got into politics.\n\n\"We New Yorkers used to tolerate him when he was just another grubby real estate hustler masquerading as a big shot, a two-bit Playboy lying his way into the tabloids, pretending to be a spokesman, a spokesperson for himself. He was calling in as himself - for himself - to fool the press into inflating his net worth,\" DeNiro alleged. \"A clown.\"\n\n\"But this city is pretty accommodating. We make room for clowns. We have them all over the city. People who do crazy things in the street; we tolerate it. It's part of the city. It's part of the culture. But not a person like Trump who'll eventually run the country,\" he continued.\n\nYou can watch De Niro's remarks in full in the video player above.\n\nRELATED: Trump trial live updates: Closing arguments begin in hush money case\n\nThe actor was sent Tuesday by Joe Biden's campaign along with two law enforcement officers who defended the U.S. Capitol on Jan. 6 to speak in an effort to refocus the presidential race on the Capitol insurrection.\n\nThe Biden campaign last week released a new ad that was narrated by De Niro sharply criticizing Trump's presidency and plans if he's reelected.\n\nDe Niro said he got involved in the ad because \"it shows the violence of Trump and reminds us that he'll use violence against anyone who stands in the way of his megalomania and greed.\"\n\nBiden's team had largely ignored Trump's trial since it began six weeks ago, but announced they were holding an event with \"special guests\" Tuesday outside the courthouse.\n\nSeveral of Trump's political allies have made appearances outside the courthouse throughout the trial as well, including U.S. House Speaker Mike Johnson, U.S. Rep. Byron Donalds of Florida, North Dakota Gov. Doug Burgum, former GOP candidate Vivek Ramaswamy, and several U.S. senators including JD Vance of Ohio, Tommy Tuberville of Alabama and Rick Scott of Florida.\n\nTrump's campaign lined up allies to appear at the courthouse to attack witnesses and others whom Trump is barred by a judge's gag order from criticizing himself.\n\nDonalds and Burgum are both considered possible vice presidential candidates for Trump.\n\nEarlier, Trump spoke to reporters as he made his way into the courtroom.\n\nThe former president carried a sheet of paper and read quotes off of it from political and legal commentators who have attacked the hush money case, a feature Trump has made a regular part of his trial routine. He called Judge Juan M. Merchan \"corrupt\" and \"conflicted\" but said he couldn't speak about it because of the gag order.\n\n\"We'll see how it goes. This is a very dangerous day for America. It's a very sad day,\" Trump said.\n\nHe was accompanied by three of his children, Don Jr., Eric and Tiffany, along with one of his de facto campaign managers Susie Wiles.\n\nRELATED: Trump hush money trial: Insights from previous high-profile cases\n\nProsecutors say the former president falsified internal business records to cover up hush money payments tied to a scheme to buy and bury negative stories that potentially threatened his 2016 presidential bid.\n\nHe has denied the allegations and pleaded not guilty to all 34 felony counts.\n\nClosing arguments are expected to last all day The Hollywood legend did justice to the role, bashing the former POTUS in his scathing address. De Niro alleged that Trump would only destroy \"this city,\" and eventually the world if voted in. He also referred to the presidential aspirant as a \"clown,\" noting that everyone could kiss their freedom goodbye \"if Trump returns to the white house.\"\n\nRobert De Niro's presence did not sit well with Donald Trump's supporters, especially in the heat of the hush money trail's closing arguments. Not minding the security detail surrounding the actor, angry Trump supporters heckled him right outside the courtroom, hauling expletives at him. Many also threw words accusing De Niro of being a traitor to his people and the Jews.\n\nAt some point, Robert De Niro seemed fed up with the obscenities, halting his steps to fire back at the MAGA mob, per TMZ. He shot,\n\n\"We're trying to be gentlemen in this world, the Democrats. You are gangsters! F-k you!!!\"\n\nHis comment did little to quelch the sea of vitriol around him, but De Niro did not seem to mind. Days back, Joe Biden's campaign released an advertisement condemning Trump's second bid for the presidency, calling him \"out of control.\" The voice behind the Biden-approved campaign was none other than De Niro.
